long: Meaning: properly, something "round" (as "excavated" or "bored"), i.e. a chafing-"dish" for coals or a "caldron" for cooking; hence (from similarity of form) a "washbowl"; also (for the same reason) a "pulpit" or platform.  Usage: hearth, laver, pan, scaffold.  Source: or "כִּיֹּר"; from the same as "H3564";
